result.execSummary:
The defendant Amanda A Lavey was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court will consider motion to terminate Probation Early.

miscConds.notes:
All Costs and Surcharges to be paid as a Condition of Probation at the rate of $100.00 per month starting 06-01-2015.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

Complete Anger Management Course.
No contact with victim.

records.addlTxt: Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been satisfied.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Amanda A Lavey in court with attorney Perry P. Lieuallen.  Ted S. Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Plea Colloquy.

Defendant enters a guilty plea to Counts 1 and 3.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Count 2 is dismissed and read in.

The Court Orders the Following:

Count 1

Withheld Sentence of:
(Credit - 0 days)

Term of Probation: 12 months  Court will consider motion to terminate probation early.

Conditions of Probation:
- AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
- Complete Anger Managment Course;
- Perform  20 hours of community service within 10 months;
- Maintain/Obtain full time employment;
- No contact with victim .

Costs: $343.00 
DNA Surcharge:  $200.00


Count 3

Withheld Sentence of:
(Credit - 0 days)

Term of Probation: 12 months  Concurrent to Count 1

Conditions of Probation:  Same as Count 1

Costs: $343.00 
DNA Surcharge:  $200.00

Costs and Surcharges  to be paid as a condition of probation at the rate of $100.00  per month commencing 6-1-15
Attorney Perry P. Lieuallen in court.   Defendant Amanda A Lavey did not appear.   Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Hearing scheduled for May 4, 2015 at 09:30 am.
